items.stem: What is the most common congenital heart defect?
items.explanation: Ventricular Septal Defect (VSD) is the most frequently diagnosed congenital heart anomaly in children.

items.stem: A 2-month-old infant with a large VSD is likely to present with which of the following signs?

options.text: A loud, harsh murmur and no other symptoms

items.explanation: Large VSDs cause a significant left-to-right shunt, leading to increased pulmonary blood flow and symptoms of congestive heart failure, such as poor feeding and tachypnea, typically in infancy.
